info.title: Trust Mile Consumer Application
info.description:
Describes the API for the Consumer App

## correlationID
  This parameter is returned with every request.

  The intent is that the server side will generate a unique id for each request, and feature this ID in all logging that occurs.  This will allow us to very easily to resolve issues faced consumers of the API.  When questioned with 'Why didn't this work' or 'This isn't working correctly' - we can identify the request server-side and easily identify events on the server associated with that request.

  My intent is to generate a log/trace of every request

## Deliveries
  'What is a delivery' Currently a delivery can only be tracked using the aftership api at the consignment level.

post.description:
## __Service: Login__
Logs a user in to their account and returns the API key to be used in subsequent requests.  Returns the status of the users email verification via the 'account' object

schema.description: Required data for user login

password.description: The password associated with the username

installationInformation.description: A collection of information that describes an instance of the application and what device it is running on.

OSMajorVersion.description: The major version of the mobile OS

OSMinorVersion.description: the minor version of the mobile OS

DeviceIdentifier.description: the device ID of the mobile device

ApplicationVersion.description: the version of the application installed, such as 1  or 1.1 or 1.1.1

200.description: the login was sucessful.  The users 'account' is returned so that the 'email verified' status can be determineed

post.description:
## Service: Signup

Creates a new user account and logs in the user. Returns an apiKey to be used in subsequent requests.

After signup the user will be unable to proceed until their email address is verified.  The users device information is caputired at this stage.

schema.description: Content required for registering an account

installationInformation.description: A collection of information that describes an instance of the application and what device it is running on.

OSMajorVersion.description: The major version of the mobile OS

OSMinorVersion.description: the minor version of the mobile OS

DeviceIdentifier.description: the device ID of the mobile device

ApplicationVersion.description: the version of the application installed, such as 1  or 1.1 or 1.1.1

location.description: Essentially latitude and logitude of user's address

422.description: the username was not an email address or the password failed complexity requirements

## Service: Forgot Password

Triggers an reset password email to be sent to the supplied email address.
** Impelemtned **

schema.description: Forgotten password reset request

200.description: a reset password link was sent to the email address

404.description: the email address was not found

put.description: resends the email verification email.  The email address is found based on the supplied apiKey ** Implemented **

schema.description: Not authorized.  Either the authorization key was missing or not present

409.description: the email address is already verified

get.description: Caller is proving he has received email by doing this get. ** Implemented **

schema.description: Not authorized.  Either the authorization key was missing or not present

409.description: the email address is already verified

delete.description:
## Service: Reset Signup

Allows a user to delete their account.  Currently only supported when the email address has not been verified.

The account to delete is based on the apiKey.  After this call the apiKey is invalidated.

** Implemented **

schema.description: Not authorized.  Either the authorization key was missing or not present

409.description: the email address on the account is already verified

Allows a user to change their password.
** Implemented **

Not authorized.  Either the authorization key was missing or not present

post.description:
##Service: Add Delivery

Adds a delivery to the users delivery list. Requires a:
- trackingNumber
(eg. LV9006545301000600205 )
- courierSlug
(eg. australia-post)

schema.description: The tracking number and courier slug for a given parcel required to be added to the user's account

400.description: A required field was not supplied

schema.description: Not authorized.  Either the authorization key was missing or not present

get.description:
** This is implemnted **
## Service: Get Deliveries

Retrieves a list of the users deliveries.

Returns a list of *Delivery* objects that should not yet be relegated to History. Some of which are *CourierDelivery*s and others are *NeighbourDelivery*s. Included in the list are all:
- open *Delivery*s
- closed *Delivery*s with unread messages
- closed *Delivery*s that were closed within the last 3 days, or last had a newly read message in the past 3 days

Note that *Delivery*s in a state of "Picked Up - Leave Feedback" are returned as "Closed" to all users that are not the Owner of the *Delivery*

The sort order is:
- Open *NeighbourDelivery*s where I am the neighbour
- Open *NeighbourDelivery*s where I need to pickup
- Open *CourierDelivery*s
- Closed *NeighbourDelivery*s with unread *Message*s
- Closed *NeighbourDelivery*s and *CourierDelivery*s sorted by closed date

Retrieves an object describing application settings to apply to this users application installiation, this object is 'piggey backed' on this call

The *ApplicationSettings* object includes:
- *ShowMessages* : show/hide the messages icon (no messages until ready for neighbour collections)
- *OfferNeighbourSignupInMenu* : yes/no to offer neighbour signup in the SETTINGS menu
- *PromptForNeighbourSignup* : yes/no to show a neighbour signup prompt on My Deliveries
      #This functionality is undefined
- *IsTrustMileNeighbour : yes/no that this user has given permission to receive deliveries on behalf of others
        ## This setting controls if neighbour settings are shown in the consumer app
        ## This setting will be true if - the neighbour is opted in OR if the neighbour is in the opting-out process
        ## Should we rename this to 'DisplayNeighbourScreens'
- *HeartbeaSht* : 0 (off) or greater, being the number of minutes between sending heartbeats to the server
- *TrustMileFeedback* : show / hide capture of feedback for TrustMile on feedback screen


#Retrieves the number of unread messages for the user.

** V1 implemented - needs adding in TrustmileDelivery option **

200.description: the list of deliveries, may be empty

items.description: A single summary of delivery info
reperesents 1 tracking event for a delivery

isTrustMileEvent.description: true means this is a trustmile event, false means this is a courier event

tag.description: a code to describe this event, for courier events the tag will be the AfterShip tag.  For trustmile events the set of tages has not yet been determined

message.description: a free-form text description of the event

get.description:
##Service: Get Tracking

Retrieves the tracking information for a delivery.  The tracking information can be a mix of Courier and TrustMile tracking events.  THe events are returned in their correct order.

200.description: Delivery info but with tracking events inside it.

delivery.description: A single summary of delivery info

items.description: reperesents 1 tracking event for a delivery

isTrustMileEvent.description: true means this is a trustmile event, false means this is a courier event

tag.description: a code to describe this event, for courier events the tag will be the AfterShip tag.  For trustmile events the set of tages has not yet been determined

message.description: a free-form text description of the event

404.description: the deliveryId was not found, or the user dfoes not have permission to view the tracking for this deliveryId

post.description:
##Service: Send delivery feedback on a "delivered item"
The item must have tag u'Delivered' in aftership
Options are current:
Not delivered (multiselect of options below should clarify this one)
Had to collect inconveniently (poor failed delivery experience)
Goods damaged in transit (explicitly courier damage)
Left in exposed location (covers insecure and weather exposure)
Unprofessional courier (covers attitude, clothing, smell)
Didnt knock or ring doorbell (courier honesty)
Took longer than promised (will be a common reason for dissatisfaction)

schema.description: Delivery Feedback on delivered item

200.description: Delivery info but with tracking events inside it.

schema.description: Not authorized.  Either the authorization key was missing or not present

404.description: the deliveryId was not found, or the user dfoes not have permission to view the tracking for this deliveryId

left in his/her mailbox.

200.description: Returns the name and address of the neighbour with the parcel and other data.

schema.description: Not authorized.  Either the authorization key was missing or not present

get.description:
## Service: Neighbour Receiving parcels.
This is the first scan of an item which
Called by a neighbour.  returns all the articles to be picked up on this delivery.
They should be part of a TrustmileDelivery grouping of 1 or more parcels.
Returns all the article Ids.
(Note it is possible we want to return more info such as the desired end recipient etc)
** Implemented **

200.description: a list of deliveries and their articles

schema.description: Returned as a result of scanning the first item of a TMD

items.description: A single physical article.  Consists of a tracking number and an item number, for cases where a TrackingNumber consists of several parcels.

alternateRecipient.description: An object corrosponding to a users 'account'

location.description: Essentially latitude and logitude of user's address

schema.description: Not authorized.  Either the authorization key was missing or not present

403.description: The delivery is not one of the neighbours deliveries

post.description: Used by consumer to complete delivery, state should be NEIGHBOUR_RECEIVED for the TrustmileDelivery

schema.description: List of articles for the neighbour receive post operation
Not authorized.  Either the authorization key was missing or not present

403.description: The delivery is not one of the neighbours deliveries

422.description: The the delivery has been picked up.  Modifications not allowed

post.description:
##Service: Do Pickup

Used by a neighbour to 'hand off' an article to a receiver.
The articles on the delivery and their state are returned from this request to 'piggy back' off the request.

_return data dependant on final schema design_
** Impemented **

schema.description: Not authorized.  Either the authorization key was missing or not present

403.description: The delivery is not one of the neighbours deliveries

409.description: the article does not belong to the receiver

422.description: the article has already been marked as handed over

delete.description:
##Service: Cancel Pickup

cancels a handoff
** James TDB **

ApplicationSettings.description: a set of properties used to enable & disable features on the client

showMessages.description: show/hide the messages icon (no messages until ready for neighbour collections)

offerNeighbourSignupInMenu.description: yes/no to offer neighbour signup in the SETTINGS menu

promptForNeighbourSignup.description: yes/no to show a neighbour signup prompt on My Deliveries

isTrustMileNeighbour.description: yes/no that this user has given permission to receive deliveries on behalf of others

heartbeat.description: 0 (off) or greater, being the number of minutes between sending heartbeats to the server

trustMileFeedback.description: show / hide capture of feedback for TrustMile on feedback screen

Conversation.description: represents a single conversation.  A conversation may or may not be tied to a delivery.  It is also possible to have a conversation that has not yet started - the messages tab will show a list of conversation AND neighbour pickups that the user can create a conversation againt, in this situation the conversationId will be null

conversationId.description: The conversationId of the conversation.  This value can be null in cases where the user has the ability to start a conversation but no conversation has been started.  A conversationId can exist with 0 messages in the conversation.

unreadMessage.description: the number of messagesd in the conversation the user has not read

totalMessages.description: the total number of messages in the conversation

deliveryId.description: If this message relates to a , the ID of the delivery.  Null indicates a  system message

deliveriestate.description: the collection state of the pickup (delivery).  one of 'ready to pickup', 'collected awaiting feedback', 'collected, closed'

neighbourAddress.description: the pickup address of the neighbour

systemMessageTitle.description: when this is a system message, this is the title to display on the conversations screen

Message.description: a single message in a conversation

sequenceNumber.description: the order of this message in this conversation

isUnread.description: has the user read this message or not.

from.description: text description of the person who wrote this message.

isFromMe.description: was this message sent but the requesting user

FeedbackMessage.description: the content of a feedback post

password.description: The password associated with the username
